column5: For the record, Doc had to back out of a trip a few years ago and that left us with three. Our plan was to have two in a boat and then we secured another boat for the odd guy, which we planned to rotate. After the first day we fished three to the boat (16 ft. Lund) and it worked out fine except for my son who had to train himself to look behind before throwing his jig. We really had a lot of fun since we had a new guy with us experiencing Canada for the first time. My advice- go for it! FISH ON! Hooks

I would not hesitate to go three in a boat at Miniss. The boats are 16' Alumarines with 15 HP Honda's on them. They have flat bottoms in them and they are nice and wide for stability. Miniss is a large lake but it is broken up by hundreds of islands so you can always find some calmer water to fish if the wind kicks up. Feel free to PM me if you want any info on the lake or camp as well as what you might need to take on your first fly-in. I'm sure Mike Borger will help you out with some expert intel on the lake.
My three sons are now married, living in France and nearby but independent. I would love to spend one full week with all three sons. I hope you put the trip together.

A fly-in for my two sons and I has been on my mind for a long time. My oldest graduates college this May. I've never done a fly-in so I have a rookie question/issue I wrestle with. With both boys in college I don't see them much, I want us to fish together so we can hang out. How do you handle three guys on a camp boat? (I am aware there is a four person minimum).

I fish Ontario with my 2 daughters every year. It's a little more crowded than I'd prefer but not really a problem. If fishing with 3 in a boat is what it takes to spend time with my 2 kids I'll take it every time and be happy about it. After your oldest graduates and gets a job/career you may never again have the opportunity. Grab it while you can!!
It's such a great idea! Fishing 3 in a boat isn't horrible, especially if it's your boys.
we often jig 3 to a boat and its fun....but im not a fan of 3 when trolling at all

Fished 3 in a boat at Slate Falls Hooker Lake outpost and had plenty of room in the boat. We were pretty much just jigging for walleye. It was last trip my father was able to take and first trip for my daughter. I have been too may times to count and that trip was better than any that I fished 2 in the boat.
